channel.title: Guido van Rossum's Weblog
channel.description: Artima Weblogs is a community of bloggers posting on a wide range of topics of interest to software developers.

item.title: Python 3000 and You
item.description: I've posted the slides from my PyCon 2008 keynote on python.org. Here are the URLs, plus a warning against the temptation of changing your APIs at the same time as porting to Py3k. This is really important!

item.title: Python 3.0 alpha 2 Released!
item.description: Another milestone in Python 3000 development: alpha 2 is released. Now with immutable bytes!

item.title: Google Highly Open Participation Contest
item.description: The Google Open Source Office is outdoing itself with a new contest aimed at a younger generation of coders: students ages 13 or older.

item.title: Myths About Indentation in Python
item.description: I stumbled upon a particularly lucid explanation of Python's significant indentation, by Oliver Fromme of secnetics GmbH.

item.title: A Response to Bruce Eckel
item.description: Bruce Eckel blogged about "Python 3K or Python 2.9?". A lively discussion ensued. Here's my response.

item.title: It isn't Easy to Remove the GIL
item.description: A response to a blog post by Juergen Brendel pleading for the removal of the GIL.

item.title: Syncing Motorola RAZR v3xx With Mac iSync 2.4
item.description: I gave my wife a new phone for her birthday. But it was not recognized by iSync (I guess the phone is too new). I found a hint on an Italian bulletin board which I a am copying now.

item.title: Python 3000 alpha 1 Released!
item.description: The first Python 3000 release is out -- Python 3.0a1. Be the first one on your block to download it!

item.title: Python Sprint @ Google
item.description: Lesley Hawthorn wrote a brief summary of the activities at the Python Sprint at Google last week.

item.title: Python Bites (off-topic)
item.description: Two gruesome pictures of a Python caught in an electric fence. Warning: not for the faint of heart.

item.title: Python 3000 Sprint @ Google
item.description: The second annual Python Sprint @ Google is happening: August 22-25 (Wed-Sat), in Mountain View and Chicago.

item.title: Python 3000 Plea for Help
item.description: We're closing in on the first Python 3000 alpha release (promised for the end of August). I'd love help with fixing the last 11 unit tests that are still failing.

item.title: More Questions About Python 3000 Answered
item.description: Last week I started a Python 3000 FAQ, and solicited additional questions. Here are some additional answers.

item.title: Python 3000 FAQ
item.description: Some questions that people often ask about Python 3000 (and answers). (First in a series of posts.)

item.title: Tim O'Reilly in China
item.description: A quick comment on an off-the-cuff remark by Tim O'Reilly
